abstract.p: John L Weinberg, 75, receives $3 million raise to $5 million a year under new two-year contract as a company adviser at Goldman Sachs Group, and will receive an additional $5 million when contract expires or is terminated; Weinberg is marking 50th anniversary at firm (M)

block.p: John L. Weinberg's 50th anniversary at the Goldman Sachs Group is truly turning out to be golden.

Mr. Weinberg, 75, received a huge raise last month when he renewed his contract as a company adviser. A former senior partner and co-chairman and now a director, Mr. Weinberg is earning $5 million annually under a new two-year contract, up from $2 million a year under his last contract. According to a letter to Mr. Weinberg from Henry M. Paulson Jr., Goldman's chairman and chief executive, Mr. Weinberg will receive an additional $5 million when his contract expires or is terminated.
